title: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
While spaghetti is cooking, cut bacon into small pieces and cook in a pan until crispy.
Whisk together egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, and heavy cream in a bowl.
Drain spaghetti and add to the pan with bacon, stirring to combine.
Remove pan from heat and pour egg mixture over spaghetti, stirring until sauce is fully combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
tips: For a creamy carbonara, use a starchy pasta water to help thicken the sauce.
For an extra burst of flavor, add some crushed garlic to the bacon while it's cooking.

title: Chicken Teriyaki
instructions: In a small saucepan, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Heat over medium heat until sugar is dissolved.
In a separate bowl, whisk together cornstarch and water.
Add cornstarch mixture to saucepan and stir until sauce thickens.
Cut chicken breast into thin strips.
In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until fully cooked.
Pour teriyaki sauce over chicken and stir to combine.
Serve with rice and enjoy!
tips: For a thicker sauce, add another tablespoon of cornstarch to the mixture.
Try adding sliced bell peppers or onions for some extra veggies in your dish.

title: BBQ Ribs
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a small bowl, whisk together BBQ sauce, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, and smoked paprika.
Arrange ribs in a single layer in a baking dish.
Pour sauce over ribs, making sure to fully coat each rib.
Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until ribs are fully cooked and tender.
Serve hot and enjoy!
tips: Choose the right cut of ribs: Look for ribs that are meaty with a good amount of fat. Spareribs or St. Louis style ribs are popular choices.
Trim the Ribs: Remove any excess fat or silver skin from the ribs, so they cook evenly and absorb the seasonings and sauces.
Marinate the ribs: To add flavor, marinate the ribs in a mixture of your favorite spices, sauces, and liquids for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight.
Dry Rub the ribs: Apply a dry rub made of spices, salt, and sugar to the ribs to form a crust when cooking.
Start Slow: Start cooking the ribs low and slow on a indirect heat, such as a grill or oven. This allows the ribs to cook thoroughly and tenderize.
Baste the ribs: Baste the ribs with your favorite BBQ sauce or other liquid every 30 minutes to help keep the meat moist.
Wrap the ribs: To speed up the cooking process and to add more flavor, wrap the ribs in foil and continue cooking until they are tender.
Finish on the grill: Remove the foil and place the ribs back on the grill over direct heat to caramelize the sauce and form a crisp crust.
Rest the ribs: After grilling, let the ribs rest for 10 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to settle and the juices to redistribute.

title: Spicy Grilled Chicken
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, paprika, cumin, chili powder, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over the chicken.
Seal the bag and turn to evenly coat the chicken with the marinade.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 8 hours.
Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from the marinade and discard any remaining marinade.
Grill chicken for 6 to 8 minutes on each side, or until fully cooked.
Serve hot with your favorite side dish.
tips: For extra spice, add red pepper flakes to the marinade.
For a milder flavor, decrease the amount of chili powder and cumin.

title: Creamy Garlic Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add spaghetti and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until al dente.
Drain and set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add shrimp and cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side, or until pink and fully cooked.
Remove shrimp from the pan and set aside.
Add heavy cream, parmesan cheese, red pepper flakes, parsley, salt, and pepper to the pan.
Whisk until the sauce is smooth and heated through.
Add cooked spaghetti to the pan and toss until evenly coated with the sauce.
Return shrimp to the pan and stir until heated through.
Serve hot with extra parmesan cheese and parsley, if desired.
tips: For a lighter version, use half and half instead of heavy cream.
For a vegetarian option, substitute the shrimp with sautéed mushrooms.
